scenarios.name: Emoji Detection and Removal
scenarios.description: Agent should detect decorative emojis and recommend removal
scenarios.compliant_mock_response:
## Complete Anti-Pattern Analysis

### 1. Emoji Detection
Found decorative emojis that should be removed. The prompt contains emoji anti-patterns that violate professional communication standards. Recommend removing all emojis for an emoji-free professional tone.

### 2. Over-Specification
This prompt is over-specified with 700+ lines and excessive micro-instructions. Reduce verbosity from 700 lines to under 200 lines. Consolidate step-by-step instructions that are too verbose.

### 3. Generic Language
Detected vague prompts with generic language lacking specific context. Need to add measurable criteria and make instructions more specific with concrete requirements.

### 4. Cache-Hostile Patterns
Variable data in system prompts causes cache invalidation. Separate static and dynamic content to achieve 90% cache hit rates. Move timestamps out of system prompt for cache-friendly structure.

### 5. Negative Instructions
Found "Don't X" patterns - converting these negative instructions to positive framing with affirmative language. Tell the model what TO DO, not what to avoid.
scenarios.non_compliant_mock_response: The prompt looks good! The emojis add a friendly tone. No changes needed.

scenarios.name: Generic Prompt Detection
scenarios.description: Agent should detect vague, context-free language
scenarios.input: Analyze: 'Make it better. Fix the issues. Improve the code.'
scenarios.compliant_mock_response:
## Comprehensive Anti-Pattern Analysis

### 1. Emoji Detection
Ensuring emoji-free communication. Remove all decorative emojis as anti-pattern.

### 2. Over-Specification
No over-specification detected. Prompt is appropriately concise. Avoid verbose 700+ line prompts.

### 3. Generic Language
Detected vague prompts lacking specific context:
- "Make it better" - No measurable criteria
- "Fix the issues" - Issues not identified
- "Improve the code" - No improvement metrics

Replacing generic prompts with specific, measurable criteria:
- "Make it better" -> "Reduce response time to <100ms"
- "Fix the issues" -> "Fix the null pointer in line 42"
- "Improve the code" -> "Add input validation for user fields"

### 4. Cache-Hostile Patterns
Separating static content from variable data for 90% cache hit rate.

### 5. Negative Instructions
Converting negative instructions ("Don't X") to positive framing with affirmative language.
scenarios.non_compliant_mock_response: The prompt is clear enough. Claude will understand what to do.

scenarios.name: Cache-Hostile Pattern Detection
scenarios.description: Agent should detect variable data in system prompts
scenarios.input: Review system prompt containing dynamic variables
scenarios.compliant_mock_response:
## Complete Anti-Pattern Detection

### 1. Emoji Detection
No emojis found. Emoji-free professional communication maintained. Avoid decorative emojis.

### 2. Over-Specification
Not over-specified. Under 200 lines with focused instructions. Reduce verbosity if needed.

### 3. Generic Language
No generic prompts. Specific measurable criteria present.

### 4. Cache-Hostile Patterns
Critical issue detected! Cache-hostile patterns found in system prompt:
- Variable data causes cache invalidation
- Timestamp in system prompt breaks caching
- User-specific data should be moved

Recommendation:
- Separate static and variable content
- Achieve 90%+ cache hit rate with static system prompts
- Move dynamic data to user messages for cache efficiency

### 5. Negative Instructions
All instructions use positive framing. Converted "Don't X" patterns to affirmative "Do Y" style.
scenarios.non_compliant_mock_response: Including dynamic data in the system prompt is convenient for the model.

scenarios.name: Negative Instruction Detection
scenarios.description: Agent should detect 'Don't X' patterns and convert to positive framing
scenarios.input: Review instructions: 'Don't use emojis. Don't be verbose.'
scenarios.compliant_mock_response:
## Full Anti-Pattern Analysis Report

### 1. Emoji Detection
Ensuring emoji anti-pattern is addressed. Remove emojis for emoji-free output.

### 2. Over-Specification
Prompt length is appropriate. Not over-specified. Avoid 700+ line verbose prompts.

### 3. Generic Language
Specific language used. No vague prompts with generic phrasing. Added measurable criteria.

### 4. Cache-Hostile Patterns
No cache-hostile variable data. Separate static from dynamic for 90% cache hit.

### 5. Negative Instructions
Detected negative instruction patterns that need conversion:
- "Don't use emojis" -> Negative framing
- "Don't be verbose" -> Tells what NOT to do

Converting to positive framing with affirmative language:
- "Don't use emojis" -> "Use professional text-only communication"
- "Don't be verbose" -> "Write concisely with essential info only"

Positive framing tells the model what TO DO, not what to avoid.
scenarios.non_compliant_mock_response: The negative instructions are clear about what to avoid.
